column5: Is anyone familiar with the fishing in Whitney area?  What is there and which are the best lakes?  Mostly interested in Hay Lake, Bark Lake, and Galeairy Lake.  Looks like I am about to close a deal on a place there.  Cheers.
There's no fish over there  I've caught some nice eyes over the years in Bark--big smallies as well
Have to agree with bushart. Nofish in hay/drizzle or bark lakes. When I get some time I will pm ya some info
You're also right on the doorstep of Algonquin Park as well. And everyone knows there's no fish there either.
well not without a canoe eating 5km carry at least

House is bought, boat is bought, and you almost gave me a heart attack,,,till I saw the sarcasm sign. Any info would be appreciated, but if nothing else they look like beautiful lakes. Glad I am getting the electric motor too for some quiet motoring.  Cheers.

Hi guys..  Noticed Galeairy being mentioned in a previous post.  I'm heading up there with the family for a week of camping in late July.  I've been fishing Algonquin for the past 4 years (middle of august) and have absolutely no luck on the trout lakes.  Went to a lake which I was told had smallies, but all I got were rock bass (gross).  Are there any bass/walleye/pike in Galeairy?  I'd really like the kids to catch something this year.  They got quite frustrated last year fishing all day and coming up with a few rock bass and sunfish Thanks in advance. Chris.
